classes.name: ActionEvent
classes.description: A semantic event indicating that a component-defined action occurred. Generated when a button is clicked, a menu item is selected, or a list item is double-clicked. Heavily used in Ignition Vision event handlers.

params.name: source
params.description: The object that originated the event

params.name: id
params.description: An integer that identifies the event type (ACTION_PERFORMED)

params.name: command
params.description: A string that may specify a command associated with the event

constructors.description: Constructs an ActionEvent object with the specified source, type, and command string.

params.name: source
params.description: The object that originated the event

params.name: id
params.description: An integer that identifies the event type (ACTION_PERFORMED)

params.name: command
params.description: A string that may specify a command associated with the event

params.name: modifiers
params.description: The modifier keys held down during this action (bitwise OR of SHIFT_MASK, CTRL_MASK, META_MASK, ALT_MASK)

constructors.description: Constructs an ActionEvent object with the specified source, type, command string, and modifier keys.

methods.name: getActionCommand

returns.description: The command string associated with this action event

methods.description: Returns the command string associated with this action. For a button, this is typically the button's label text.

methods.name: getModifiers

returns.description: The bitwise OR of the modifier constants

methods.description: Returns the modifier keys held down during this action event. The value is a bitwise OR of SHIFT_MASK, CTRL_MASK, META_MASK, and ALT_MASK.

methods.name: getWhen

returns.description: The timestamp of when this event occurred, in milliseconds since epoch

methods.description: Returns the timestamp of when this event occurred.

methods.name: getSource

returns.description: The object on which the event initially occurred

methods.description: Returns the object on which the event initially occurred. Inherited from EventObject.

methods.name: paramString

returns.description: A string identifying the event and its attributes

methods.description: Returns a parameter string identifying this action event. Useful for event logging and debugging.

methods.name: toString

returns.description: A string representation of this ActionEvent

methods.description: Returns a string representation of this ActionEvent.

fields.name: ACTION_PERFORMED
fields.description: An event ID indicating that a meaningful action occurred (1001).

fields.name: SHIFT_MASK
fields.description: The Shift key modifier constant (1).

fields.name: CTRL_MASK
fields.description: The Control key modifier constant (2).

fields.name: META_MASK
fields.description: The Meta key modifier constant (4).

fields.name: ALT_MASK
fields.description: The Alt key modifier constant (8).

classes.name: MouseEvent
classes.description: An event indicating that a mouse action occurred in a component. Mouse events include clicks, presses, releases, movement, enter/exit, and dragging. One of the most commonly handled events in Ignition Vision client scripts.

constructors.signature: MouseEvent(source, id, when, modifiers, x, y, clickCount, popupTrigger)

params.name: source
params.description: The Component that originated the event

params.name: id
params.description: The integer event type (e.g., MOUSE_CLICKED, MOUSE_PRESSED)

params.name: when
params.description: A long integer that gives the time the event occurred, in milliseconds since epoch

params.name: modifiers
params.description: The modifier keys held down during this event (bitwise OR of modifier constants)

params.name: x
params.description: The horizontal x coordinate for the mouse location relative to the source component

params.name: y
params.description: The vertical y coordinate for the mouse location relative to the source component

params.name: clickCount
params.description: The number of mouse clicks associated with this event

params.name: popupTrigger
params.description: True if this event is a popup menu trigger

constructors.description: Constructs a MouseEvent object with the specified source component, type, time, modifiers, coordinates, click count, and popup trigger flag.

methods.name: getX

returns.description: The horizontal x position of the event relative to the source component

methods.description: Returns the horizontal x position of the event relative to the source component.

methods.name: getY

returns.description: The vertical y position of the event relative to the source component

methods.description: Returns the vertical y position of the event relative to the source component.

methods.name: getPoint

returns.description: A Point object containing the x and y coordinates relative to the source component

methods.description: Returns the x,y position of the event relative to the source component as a Point object.

methods.name: getClickCount

returns.description: The number of mouse clicks associated with this event

methods.description: Returns the number of mouse clicks associated with this event. For MOUSE_CLICKED events, this distinguishes single, double, and triple clicks.

methods.name: getButton

returns.description: One of NOBUTTON, BUTTON1, BUTTON2, or BUTTON3

methods.description: Returns which mouse button has changed state. Returns NOBUTTON for events not associated with a specific button change (e.g., MOUSE_MOVED).

methods.name: isPopupTrigger

returns.description: True if this mouse event is the popup menu trigger event for the platform

methods.description: Returns whether this mouse event is the popup menu trigger event for the platform. The popup trigger varies by platform; on Windows it is typically a right-click release.

methods.name: getModifiers

returns.description: The modifier mask for this event

methods.description: Returns the modifier mask for this event. Use getModifiersEx() for the extended modifier mask.

methods.name: getModifiersEx

returns.description: The extended modifier mask for this event

methods.description: Returns the extended modifier mask for this event. Extended modifiers represent the state of all modal keys and mouse buttons at the time of the event.

methods.name: isShiftDown

returns.description: True if the Shift key was held down during this event

methods.description: Returns whether the Shift modifier key was down during this event.

methods.name: isControlDown

returns.description: True if the Control key was held down during this event

methods.description: Returns whether the Control modifier key was down during this event.

methods.name: isAltDown

returns.description: True if the Alt key was held down during this event

methods.description: Returns whether the Alt modifier key was down during this event.

methods.name: isMetaDown

returns.description: True if the Meta key was held down during this event

methods.description: Returns whether the Meta modifier key was down during this event.

methods.name: getSource

returns.description: The object on which the event initially occurred

methods.description: Returns the object on which the event initially occurred. Inherited from EventObject.

methods.name: getComponent

returns.description: The Component that originated the event

methods.description: Returns the originator of the event. Inherited from ComponentEvent.

methods.name: getID

returns.description: The integer event type

methods.description: Returns the event type identifier (e.g., MOUSE_CLICKED, MOUSE_PRESSED).

methods.name: getWhen

returns.description: The timestamp of when this event occurred, in milliseconds since epoch

methods.description: Returns the timestamp of when this event occurred. Inherited from InputEvent.

methods.name: paramString

returns.description: A string identifying the event and its attributes

methods.description: Returns a parameter string identifying this event. Useful for event logging and debugging.

fields.name: MOUSE_CLICKED
fields.description: An event ID indicating that a mouse button was clicked (pressed and released) on a component (500).

fields.name: MOUSE_PRESSED
fields.description: An event ID indicating that a mouse button was pressed on a component (501).

fields.name: MOUSE_RELEASED
fields.description: An event ID indicating that a mouse button was released on a component (502).

fields.name: MOUSE_MOVED
fields.description: An event ID indicating that the mouse cursor was moved on a component with no buttons pressed (503).

fields.name: MOUSE_ENTERED
fields.description: An event ID indicating that the mouse cursor entered a component (504).

fields.name: MOUSE_EXITED
fields.description: An event ID indicating that the mouse cursor exited a component (505).

fields.name: MOUSE_DRAGGED
fields.description: An event ID indicating that the mouse button was pressed on a component and then dragged (506).

fields.name: MOUSE_WHEEL
fields.description: An event ID indicating that the mouse wheel was rotated on a component (507).

fields.name: BUTTON1
fields.description: Indicates mouse button 1 (typically the left button) (1).

fields.name: BUTTON2
fields.description: Indicates mouse button 2 (typically the middle button or scroll wheel click) (2).

fields.name: BUTTON3
fields.description: Indicates mouse button 3 (typically the right button) (3).

fields.name: NOBUTTON
fields.description: Indicates no mouse buttons; used for mouse movement events (0).

classes.name: KeyEvent
classes.description: An event indicating that a keystroke occurred in a component. Key events are generated when a key is pressed, released, or typed. Commonly used in Ignition Vision for keyboard shortcuts and input validation.

constructors.signature: KeyEvent(source, id, when, modifiers, keyCode, keyChar)

params.name: source
params.description: The Component that originated the event

params.name: id
params.description: The integer event type (KEY_PRESSED, KEY_RELEASED, or KEY_TYPED)

params.name: when
params.description: A long integer that gives the time the event occurred, in milliseconds since epoch

params.name: modifiers
params.description: The modifier keys held down during this event (bitwise OR of modifier constants)

params.name: keyCode
params.description: The integer code for an actual key (VK_* constants), or VK_UNDEFINED for KEY_TYPED events

params.name: keyChar
params.description: The Unicode character generated by this event, or CHAR_UNDEFINED

constructors.description: Constructs a KeyEvent object with the specified source component, type, time, modifiers, key code, and key character.

methods.name: getKeyCode

returns.description: The integer key code associated with the key in this event (one of the VK_* constants)

methods.description: Returns the integer keyCode associated with the key in this event. For KEY_TYPED events, the keyCode is VK_UNDEFINED.

methods.name: getKeyChar

returns.description: The Unicode character associated with the key in this event

methods.description: Returns the character associated with the key in this event. For KEY_PRESSED and KEY_RELEASED events of action keys, returns CHAR_UNDEFINED.

methods.name: isShiftDown

returns.description: True if the Shift key was held down during this event

methods.description: Returns whether the Shift modifier key was down during this event.

methods.name: isControlDown

returns.description: True if the Control key was held down during this event

methods.description: Returns whether the Control modifier key was down during this event.

methods.name: isAltDown

returns.description: True if the Alt key was held down during this event

methods.description: Returns whether the Alt modifier key was down during this event.

methods.name: isMetaDown

returns.description: True if the Meta key was held down during this event

methods.description: Returns whether the Meta modifier key was down during this event.

methods.name: isActionKey

returns.description: True if the key is an action key (e.g., arrow keys, function keys)

methods.description: Returns whether the key in this event is an action key. Action keys include function keys, arrow keys, Home, End, Page Up, Page Down, and similar keys that do not produce a Unicode character.

methods.name: getModifiers

returns.description: The modifier mask for this event

methods.description: Returns the modifier mask for this event. Use getModifiersEx() for the extended modifier mask.

methods.name: getModifiersEx

returns.description: The extended modifier mask for this event

methods.description: Returns the extended modifier mask for this event. Extended modifiers represent the state of all modal keys and mouse buttons at the time of the event.

methods.name: getSource

returns.description: The object on which the event initially occurred

methods.description: Returns the object on which the event initially occurred. Inherited from EventObject.

methods.name: getComponent

returns.description: The Component that originated the event

methods.description: Returns the originator of the event. Inherited from ComponentEvent.

methods.name: getID

returns.description: The integer event type

methods.description: Returns the event type identifier (KEY_PRESSED, KEY_RELEASED, or KEY_TYPED).

methods.name: getWhen

returns.description: The timestamp of when this event occurred, in milliseconds since epoch

methods.description: Returns the timestamp of when this event occurred. Inherited from InputEvent.

methods.name: paramString

returns.description: A string identifying the event and its attributes

methods.description: Returns a parameter string identifying this event. Useful for event logging and debugging.

methods.name: getKeyText

params.name: keyCode
params.description: The key code to get text for (one of the VK_* constants)

returns.description: A string describing the key code, such as "HOME", "F1", or "A"

methods.description: Returns a String describing the keyCode, such as "HOME", "F1", or "A". Useful for displaying key bindings to users.

methods.name: getKeyModifiersText

params.name: modifiers
params.description: The modifier mask to convert to text

returns.description: A string describing the modifier keys, such as "Shift" or "Ctrl+Shift"

methods.description: Returns a String describing the modifier key(s), such as "Shift" or "Ctrl+Shift".

fields.name: KEY_PRESSED
fields.description: An event ID indicating that a key was pressed (401).

fields.name: KEY_RELEASED
fields.description: An event ID indicating that a key was released (402).

fields.name: KEY_TYPED
fields.description: An event ID indicating that a key was typed (pressed and released, generating a character) (400).

fields.name: VK_ENTER
fields.description: Constant for the Enter key (10).

fields.name: VK_TAB
fields.description: Constant for the Tab key (9).

fields.name: VK_ESCAPE
fields.description: Constant for the Escape key (27).

fields.name: VK_SPACE
fields.description: Constant for the Space key (32).

fields.name: VK_BACK_SPACE
fields.description: Constant for the Backspace key (8).

fields.name: VK_DELETE
fields.description: Constant for the Delete key (127).

fields.name: VK_LEFT
fields.description: Constant for the Left arrow key (37).

fields.name: VK_RIGHT
fields.description: Constant for the Right arrow key (39).

fields.name: VK_UP
fields.description: Constant for the Up arrow key (38).

fields.name: VK_DOWN
fields.description: Constant for the Down arrow key (40).

fields.name: VK_HOME
fields.description: Constant for the Home key (36).

fields.name: VK_END
fields.description: Constant for the End key (35).

fields.name: VK_PAGE_UP
fields.description: Constant for the Page Up key (33).

fields.name: VK_PAGE_DOWN
fields.description: Constant for the Page Down key (34).

fields.name: VK_F1
fields.description: Constant for the F1 function key (112).

fields.name: VK_F2
fields.description: Constant for the F2 function key (113).

fields.name: VK_F3
fields.description: Constant for the F3 function key (114).

fields.name: VK_F4
fields.description: Constant for the F4 function key (115).

fields.name: VK_F5
fields.description: Constant for the F5 function key (116).

fields.name: VK_F6
fields.description: Constant for the F6 function key (117).

fields.name: VK_F7
fields.description: Constant for the F7 function key (118).

fields.name: VK_F8
fields.description: Constant for the F8 function key (119).

fields.name: VK_F9
fields.description: Constant for the F9 function key (120).

fields.name: VK_F10
fields.description: Constant for the F10 function key (121).

fields.name: VK_F11
fields.description: Constant for the F11 function key (122).

fields.name: VK_F12
fields.description: Constant for the F12 function key (123).

fields.name: VK_A
fields.description: Constant for the A key (65).

fields.name: VK_Z
fields.description: Constant for the Z key (90).

fields.name: VK_0
fields.description: Constant for the 0 key (48).

fields.name: VK_9
fields.description: Constant for the 9 key (57).

fields.name: VK_SHIFT
fields.description: Constant for the Shift key (16).

fields.name: VK_CONTROL
fields.description: Constant for the Control key (17).

fields.name: VK_ALT
fields.description: Constant for the Alt key (18).

classes.name: FocusEvent
classes.description: An event indicating that a component has gained or lost the input focus. Used in Ignition Vision for input validation on focus loss and UI state management.

params.name: source
params.description: The Component that originated the event

params.name: id
params.description: The integer event type (FOCUS_GAINED or FOCUS_LOST)

constructors.description: Constructs a FocusEvent object with the specified source and type.

params.name: source
params.description: The Component that originated the event

params.name: id
params.description: The integer event type (FOCUS_GAINED or FOCUS_LOST)

params.name: temporary
params.description: True if the focus change is temporary (e.g., when a window is deactivated)

constructors.description: Constructs a FocusEvent object with the specified source, type, and whether the focus change is temporary.

methods.name: isTemporary

returns.description: True if this focus change is temporary

methods.description: Identifies whether the focus change is temporary or permanent. Temporary focus changes occur when a window loses focus; the original focus owner regains focus when the window is reactivated.

methods.name: getOppositeComponent

returns.description: The other Component involved in the focus change, or null

methods.description: Returns the other Component involved in the focus change. For FOCUS_GAINED, returns the Component that lost focus. For FOCUS_LOST, returns the Component that gained focus. May return null if the other Component is not a Java Component.

methods.name: getSource

returns.description: The object on which the event initially occurred

methods.description: Returns the object on which the event initially occurred. Inherited from EventObject.

methods.name: getComponent

returns.description: The Component that originated the event

methods.description: Returns the originator of the event. Inherited from ComponentEvent.

methods.name: getID

returns.description: The integer event type

methods.description: Returns the event type identifier (FOCUS_GAINED or FOCUS_LOST).

methods.name: paramString

returns.description: A string identifying the event and its attributes

methods.description: Returns a parameter string identifying this event. Useful for event logging and debugging.

fields.name: FOCUS_GAINED
fields.description: An event ID indicating that a Component gained the input focus (1004).

fields.name: FOCUS_LOST
fields.description: An event ID indicating that a Component lost the input focus (1005).

classes.name: WindowEvent
classes.description: An event indicating that a window has changed its status. Window events include opening, closing, activation, deactivation, iconification, and focus changes. Used in Ignition Vision for window lifecycle management.

params.name: source
params.description: The Window that originated the event

params.name: id
params.description: The integer event type (e.g., WINDOW_OPENED, WINDOW_CLOSING)

constructors.description: Constructs a WindowEvent object with the specified source window and event type.

methods.name: getWindow

returns.description: The Window that originated the event

methods.description: Returns the originator of the event as a Window.

methods.name: getOppositeWindow

returns.description: The other Window involved in the focus or activation change, or null

methods.description: Returns the other Window involved in this focus or activation change. For WINDOW_ACTIVATED or WINDOW_GAINED_FOCUS, returns the Window that lost activation or focus. For WINDOW_DEACTIVATED or WINDOW_LOST_FOCUS, returns the Window that gained activation or focus. May return null.

methods.name: getOldState

returns.description: The previous state of the window for WINDOW_STATE_CHANGED events

methods.description: Returns the previous state of the window for WINDOW_STATE_CHANGED events. The state is a bitwise mask of Frame.NORMAL, Frame.ICONIFIED, Frame.MAXIMIZED_HORIZ, Frame.MAXIMIZED_VERT, or Frame.MAXIMIZED_BOTH.

methods.name: getNewState

returns.description: The new state of the window for WINDOW_STATE_CHANGED events

methods.description: Returns the new state of the window for WINDOW_STATE_CHANGED events. The state is a bitwise mask of Frame.NORMAL, Frame.ICONIFIED, Frame.MAXIMIZED_HORIZ, Frame.MAXIMIZED_VERT, or Frame.MAXIMIZED_BOTH.

methods.name: getSource

returns.description: The object on which the event initially occurred

methods.description: Returns the object on which the event initially occurred. Inherited from EventObject.

methods.name: getID

returns.description: The integer event type

methods.description: Returns the event type identifier.

methods.name: paramString

returns.description: A string identifying the event and its attributes

methods.description: Returns a parameter string identifying this event. Useful for event logging and debugging.

fields.name: WINDOW_OPENED
fields.description: An event ID indicating that a window was opened (200).

fields.name: WINDOW_CLOSING
fields.description: An event ID indicating that the user is attempting to close the window from the window's system menu (201).

fields.name: WINDOW_CLOSED
fields.description: An event ID indicating that a window has been closed as the result of calling dispose on the window (202).

fields.name: WINDOW_ACTIVATED
fields.description: An event ID indicating that a window was activated (set as the active window) (205).

fields.name: WINDOW_DEACTIVATED
fields.description: An event ID indicating that a window is no longer the active window (206).

fields.name: WINDOW_ICONIFIED
fields.description: An event ID indicating that a window was minimized (iconified) (203).

fields.name: WINDOW_DEICONIFIED
fields.description: An event ID indicating that a window was restored from a minimized state (204).

fields.name: WINDOW_GAINED_FOCUS
fields.description: An event ID indicating that a window gained input focus (207).

fields.name: WINDOW_LOST_FOCUS
fields.description: An event ID indicating that a window lost input focus (208).

fields.name: WINDOW_STATE_CHANGED
fields.description: An event ID indicating that a window's state changed (its iconified/maximized state) (209).
